description: {"blocks":[{"key":"co5os","text":"This protocol details 3D mesh cleanup tutorial of fossil plant cupule (Beginner).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"4vivl","text":"Skills developed: Basic mesh editing ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":16},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":37}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1okla","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"923a","text":"3D meshes of fossil specimens extracted directly from 3D imaging data often need post-processing to improve usability for paleontological analyses. Here, we present a step-by-step workflow that was used to digitally process a cupule of the plant fossil Petriellaea triangulata (Shi et al. 2021) (3D file download: https://doi.org/10.6084/m9.figshare.21266568). This tutorial uses the opensource mesh editing program Meshlab that can be downloaded at meshlab.net. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":253,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"83s3e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4mh1l","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ca1uh","text":"When the digitized fossil cupule was first exported as a 3D object file from the 3D processing software (Avizo Lite v. 9.2.0), a number of common issues were evident. The ridges, rough surfaces, and holes present are preservational artifacts and/or a consequence of the digital extraction process. This tutorial will walk through how to fix these issues in Meshlab (Cignoni et al. 2008). Note that this tutorial utilizes Meshlab 2021.10, though other versions will have similar layouts and functions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"60ia0","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a2eie","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1pksn","text":"References","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"41hsu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2noei","text":"Cignoni, P., Callieri, M., Corsini, M., Dellepiane, M., Ganovelli, F., Ranzuglia, G. 2008. MeshLab: an Open-Source Mesh Processing Tool. Sixth Eurographics Italian Chapter Conference, page 129-136, 2008","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cgkb1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4fd2n","text":"Kazhdan, M. and Hoppe, H. 2013. Screened Poisson surface reconstruction. ACM Trans. Graphics, 32(3).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"23rqd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cdhd5","text":"Shi, G., Herrera, F., Herendeen, P. S.,Clark, E. G.,Crane, P. R. 2021.Mesozoic cupules and the origin of the angiosperm second integument. Nature 594, 223-226. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":139,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"94414C40C24611ED98361BDD3E1BF13E","height":416,"id":352647,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2njbn3x7.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2nhbn3x7.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/k2nibn3x7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2ngbn3x7.webp","width":550}}}}
keywords: The Meshlab Interface, Shrinkwrapping the Mesh,Basic mesh editing ,fossil plant cupule

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fivse","text":"Open Meshlab and import “Cupule before.obj” into Meshlab via File \u003e Import Mesh. Alternatively, drag the file into the project window (the large purple box with the crosshairs) if using Mac.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":61,"length":4},{"style":"bold","offset":68,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"54i0d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1bd4e","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"81pce","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"FA3FABF0C3E411EDA22F8153759A32CE","height":338,"id":352655,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2ntbn3x7.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2nrbn3x7.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/k2nsbn3x7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2nqbn3x7.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ch8la","text":"The mesh now appears in the project window. You can rotate it by holding left click and dragging the cursor. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":44,"length":64}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"adbue","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e92em","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cs942","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f6mkv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"13pke","text":"When the file is imported, three new menus appear on the right. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"97cls","text":"The top menu lists the objects that are in the scene. ","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d09oh","text":"The center menu lists attributes of the object. ","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"97dcv","text":"The bottom menu keeps a history of commands performed. ","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"4ACD5090C3E511EDA22F8153759A32CE","height":320,"id":352663,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2n3bn3x7.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2nzbn3x7.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/k2n2bn3x7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2nybn3x7.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cuo44","text":"Try repositioning the mesh.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aag23","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dkddm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f8k48","text":"On a Mac, this is done by holding the command key, holding the left mouse button, and dragging the mesh. On PC, hold ctrl and the left mouse button.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8n8cn","text":"Turn the visibility of the object on and off by clicking on the eye icon in the top right menu. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":94}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1nbde","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4a5sl","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f03n1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"CB3CF410C3E511EDA22F8153759A32CE","height":296,"id":352671,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2pbbn3x7.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2n9bn3x7.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/k2pabn3x7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2n8bn3x7.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2bq7b","text":"Zoom in by scrolling with the wheel of a mouse, swiping with two fingers (on a Mac trackpad), or holding down shift and left click (in both Mac and PC) while moving the cursor up and down. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":188}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1sagd","text":"Create a new, simplified mesh over the surface of the cupule. This is known as “shrinkwrapping.” Shrinkwrapping the mesh smooths the surface and patches holes. Performed by isolating the vertices that make up the external structure of the cupule and using them to make a new mesh layer. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6bkvk","text":"Click Apply on the pop-up menu. All other settings can remain as default.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8p5mj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3dpe0","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7kvlv","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2korn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"A14E96D0C3E611EDA22F8153759A32CE","height":319,"id":352683,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2prbn3x7.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2pmbn3x7.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/k2ppbn3x7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2pkbn3x7.webp","width":550}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"19FC72F0C3E711EDA22F8153759A32CE","height":320,"id":352694,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2p3bn3x7.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2pybn3x7.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/k2p2bn3x7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2pwbn3x7.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cmbdg","text":"Next, select the dark mesh components by clicking Filters \u003e Selection \u003e Select by Vertex Quality. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bq18c","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9rgcv","text":"Zoom in and explore the view of the previewed selection inside the object.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1rml9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7a930","text":"   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"af0ju","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"BB714DE0C3E711EDA22F8153759A32CE","height":283,"id":352741,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2rhbn3x7.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2rfbn3x7.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/k2rgbn3x7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2rdbn3x7.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"11chh","text":"Select “Delete Selected Faces and Vertices” on the right of the icon-based menu towards the top of the screen. This will delete the faces and vertices in red selected in the previous step, leaving a shell of the original mesh.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":36}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ert2k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8hara","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4hr5s","text":"   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6p7od","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"6A1A6390C22B11ED98361BDD3E1BF13E","height":35,"id":352747,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2rubn3x7.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2rmbn3x7.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/k2rrbn3x7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2rkbn3x7.webp","width":550}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"E00AF4A0C25011ED98361BDD3E1BF13E","height":321,"id":352765,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2sbbn3x7.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2r7bn3x7.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/k2r9bn3x7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2r3bn3x7.webp","width":550}}}}

","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":13,"length":62}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7v2dh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ef6a4","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b2g3q","text":"Meshlab does not have an undo function; periodically creating a duplicate of the current mesh is a good way to save a checkpoint.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"ED7AE5A0C25011ED98361BDD3E1BF13E","height":320,"id":352780,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2swbn3x7.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2snbn3x7.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/k2stbn3x7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2skbn3x7.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cef42","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a0tpk","text":"Click the eye in the top row to hide the original mesh. The eye will appear closed, indicating the layer is not visible. Click the second row to select the new mesh, since any commands performed will be done on the active selection. {"blocks":[{"key":"cor2p","text":"To remove all of the faces of the mesh, select Filters \u003e Selection \u003e Select All or press command + shift + A (Mac) or ctrl + shift + A (PC).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":38,"length":17},{"style":"bold","offset":57,"length":9},{"style":"bold","offset":69,"length":10},{"style":"bold","offset":83,"length":26},{"style":"bold","offset":118,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cp5ts","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"54pbv","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c2ut5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"AA671CE0C22B11ED98361BDD3E1BF13E","height":320,"id":352808,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2tmbn3x7.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2tibn3x7.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/k2tkbn3x7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2tgbn3x7.webp","width":550}}}}

Select “Apply”.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":60,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ccvum","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6f0n7","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cd64e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"B5508A10C22B11ED98361BDD3E1BF13E","height":319,"id":352821,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2tzbn3x7.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2txbn3x7.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/k2tybn3x7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2twbn3x7.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ck6jc","text":"Delete all mesh faces by selecting “delete faces” icon in the icon-based menu: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":25,"length":52}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"77rl6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d25ch","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"899l3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"BF60FC60C22B11ED98361BDD3E1BF13E","height":321,"id":352833,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2udbn3x7.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2ubbn3x7.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/k2ucbn3x7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2t9bn3x7.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"acajm","text":"Next, the outer vertices of the cupule will be used to create a new mesh using a screened Poisson (Kazhdan and Hoppe, 2013).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dq0jg","text":"Go to Filters\u003e Remeshing, Simplification and Reconstruction \u003e Surface Reconstruction: Screened Poisson.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":6,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":15,"length":44},{"style":"bold","offset":62,"length":40}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ack0m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f186i","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6d6og","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"C95D4A70C22B11ED98361BDD3E1BF13E","height":320,"id":352843,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2urbn3x7.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2umbn3x7.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/k2uqbn3x7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2ukbn3x7.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"316ip","text":"Check the “pre-clean” box, which removes any defects in the mesh that would keep the filter from working. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"au8c6","text":"Click “Apply” in the popup menu. A new layer named “Poisson mesh” will appear in the righthand menu. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a9ntp","text":"Click the eye of your previous mesh to view the poisson mesh by itself.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":70}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3pasl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ffulo","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1d0rk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"D6273770C22B11ED98361BDD3E1BF13E","height":320,"id":352855,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2u5bn3x7.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2uzbn3x7.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/k2u4bn3x7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2uybn3x7.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8io7t","text":"The “Reconstruction Depth” ranges from 1-12, with default value as 8. To see what different reconstruction depths look like, re-select the second layer in the object list, “Cupule before,” and run the filter again with a reconstruction depth value of 4 and 12. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":70,"length":189}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dg1g6","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"s2vu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"mpl7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2o1q8","text":"   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3vq9k","text":"Toggle between viewing the new Poisson meshes on the right top menu by opening and closing the eye icon for each mesh. You will see that a higher reconstruction depth value preserves more detail, while a lower value applies more smoothing.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"C29D4660C25111ED98361BDD3E1BF13E","height":320,"id":352869,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2vhbn3x7.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2vfbn3x7.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/k2vgbn3x7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2vdbn3x7.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ets0v","text":"To rename a layer, Right click the layer \u003e Rename Current mesh\u003e rename the mesh \u003e Apply. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":19,"length":22},{"style":"bold","offset":42,"length":20},{"style":"bold","offset":64,"length":16},{"style":"bold","offset":82,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"23l5t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6t4oe","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3pf91","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"449E1DD0C3EA11EDA22F8153759A32CE","height":320,"id":352883,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2vxbn3x7.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2vvbn3x7.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/k2vwbn3x7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2vubn3x7.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"38h08","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e11bk","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6pgds","text":"First, apply another poisson remesh on top of the current poisson remesh. This time, set the Reconstruction Depth to 12. (Filters \u003e Remeshing, Simplification and Reconstruction \u003e Surface Reconstruction: Screened Poisson \u003e Reconstruction Depth = 12 \u003e Apply).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":122,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":132,"length":44},{"style":"bold","offset":179,"length":40},{"style":"bold","offset":222,"length":26},{"style":"bold","offset":250,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ir2n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bhpdg","text":"   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a8gki","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3l0gn","text":"The mesh is blocky due to the low number of polygons and relatively large size of each. There are a few ways to remedy this.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"2A71C7C0C25211ED98361BDD3E1BF13E","height":320,"id":352895,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2wbbn3x7.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2v9bn3x7.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/k2wabn3x7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2v7bn3x7.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"r9t2","text":"Next, select Filters \u003e Remeshing, Simplification and Reconstruction \u003e Subdivision Surfaces: Butterfly Subdivision. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":13,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":23,"length":44},{"style":"bold","offset":70,"length":43}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f8g37","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"25l1j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4nldq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ubdm","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"evd5g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cr17n","text":"This filter divides the polygons to increase the number comprising the mesh. Each application makes the surface appear smoother, but also exponentially increases the file size. As such, the filter should be applied the minimum number of times to create a smooth surface. In this example, the filter was applied twice.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"0688EDA0C22C11ED98361BDD3E1BF13E","height":320,"id":352909,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2wtbn3x7.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2wpbn3x7.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/k2wrbn3x7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2wkbn3x7.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"erf9g","text":"Once the reconstruction is complete, export the new mesh by selecting File \u003e Export Mesh. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":70,"length":4},{"style":"bold","offset":77,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cgsfr","text":"Select .stl as the file type. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"881cv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5o24q","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"55d4v","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6j792","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"141D2F80C22C11ED98361BDD3E1BF13E","height":320,"id":352921,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2w5bn3x7.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2w3bn3x7.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/k2w4bn3x7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2w2bn3x7.webp","width":550}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"189BD9D0C22C11ED98361BDD3E1BF13E","height":417,"id":352935,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2xmbn3x7.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2xhbn3x7.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/k2xkbn3x7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2xebn3x7.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5h3a8","text":"Keep the “unify duplicate vertices” box checked. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":47}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6q34u","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"eh7o9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"75sgg","text":"The 3D object file is made of a series of polygons. The polygons themselves are called the “faces,” and the points making up the corners are points called “vertices.” This is known as a mesh: a 3D object comprised of a series of faces and vertices. The 3D object file we imported is our fossil cupule represented digitally as a 3D mesh. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"66o52","text":"The first step is to hollow out – or remove the faces and vertices - from the inside of the mesh. The program will label which faces and vertices are inside the cupule and which are on the surface by clicking Filters \u003e Color Creation and Processing \u003e Ambient Occlusion. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":209,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":219,"length":29},{"style":"bold","offset":251,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"an0nv","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"64vis","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ui35","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9n363","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6pl2b","text":"This filter colors the internal mesh parts dark and the internal mesh parts white.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"3FCB83F0C3E611EDA22F8153759A32CE","height":319,"id":352952,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2x6bn3x7.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2x2bn3x7.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/k2x4bn3x7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k2xybn3x7.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2jpt2","text":"Next, check the “Preview” box, and a preview of the selected mesh components within that greyscale window will be highlighted in red. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":6,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"638qg","text":"Toggle the “Max Quality” slider until most of the inside components are selected. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":11,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3o2t0","text":"Then, zoom out to view the external surface of the object. The goal is to set Max Quality to select the lowest number of faces on the outside while selecting the highest number on the inside: Max Quality was set to 0.188304 in this example. Once you have achieved this balance, hit “Apply.”  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":278,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3s3kg","text":"Select the poisson mesh with the reconstruction depth of four and rename this mesh “Cupule remesh”. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":100}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ccls0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4gbmr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bsgs9","text":"It might seem counterintuitive to select the mesh with the lowest resolution. However, most of the ridges, bumps, and holes in the original mesh, captured by the poisson remeshes with reconstruction depth of 8 and 12, were preservational artifacts or consequences of CT segmentation. In certain cases, building a mesh that averages out these elements and captures the general shape of the object is appropriate.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

title: 3D Mesh Cleanup Tutorial: Fossil Plant Cupule (Beginner)
